Player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • MapObjects.Interactable
      • Player.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Player
extends Interactable
implements java.io.Serializable
    A user-controlled character that can move around the screen and interact with other map objects
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • dx

        private int dx
        Horizontal movement direction. -1 for moving left, 0 for horizontally stable (initial value), 1 for moving right.

      • dy

        private int dy
        Vertical movement direction. -1 for moving up, 0 for vertically stable (initial value), 1 for moving down.

      • SPEED

        private int SPEED
        Movement speed

      • direction

        private Direction direction
        Movement direction. Gets recalculated when dx and dy are changed to match their behaviour. Initial value is EAST.

      • status

        private PlayerStatus status
        Player status, i.e. IDLE or WALKING, etc. Gets recalculated when dx and dy are changed to match their behaviour. Initial value is IDLE.

      • health

        private int health
        Player's health

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int xLoc,
              int yLoc,
              int rWidth,
              int rHeight)
        Create a player with the given position and size, and sets up the collision box.
        Parameters:
        xLoc - The x-location of the Player
        yLoc - The y-location of the Player
        rWidth - The width of the Player
        rHeight - The height of the Player

    • Method Detail

      • getDx

        public int getDx()
        Returns the Dx of the current Player.
        Parameters:
        -
        Returns:
        The Dx of the player.

      • getDy

        public int getDy()
        Returns the Dy of the current Player
        Parameters:
        -
        Returns:
        The Dy of the player.

      • alterVelocity

        public void alterVelocity(int ddx,
                          int ddy)
        Changes the velocity of the Player relatively, and recalculates direction and status. For example, if the player is moving left then alterVelocity is called with ddx=1 ddy=1, then he will start moving down. This method also keeps the velocities bounded from -1 to 1.
        Parameters:
        ddx - The amount to change dx.
        ddy - The amount to change dy.
        See Also:
        dy, dy, direction, status

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the player according to it's speed and velocity.

        Change the player's direction to the parameter
        Parameters:
        d - The new direction

      • getHealth
